facts.text: The appellant was a tenant of the Government for many years before 1955 in respect of a part of a building which was originally evacuee property.

anchor.surface_text: For many years before 1955 the appellant was a tenant of the Government in respect of a part of a building which was originally evacuee property.

facts.text: The property was treated as part of the compensation pool and was put up for auction on December 7, 1955.

anchor.surface_text: The property was treated as part of the companypensation pool and was put up for auction on December 7, 1955.

facts.text: A bid offered by respondents 1, 2 and 3 was accepted by the Government, but no certificate was immediately issued.

anchor.surface_text: A bid offered by respondents 1, 2 and 3 in this appeal was accepted by the Government, but numbercertificate was immediately issued.

facts.text: The Managing Officer addressed a letter to respondents 1, 2 and 3 on December 8, 1956 informing them that provisional possession was decided to be given of the property subject to terms and conditions stipulated in the Indemnity Bond and the special affidavit executed by them.

anchor.surface_text: The Managing Officer addressed a letter to respondents 1, 2 and 3 on December 8, 1956 informing them that provisional possession was decided to be given of the property subject to terms and companyditions stipulated in the Indemnity Bond and the special affidavit executed by them.

facts.text: One of the conditions was that the respondents were entitled to realise rent from the tenants who were directed to attorn to respondents 1-3 with effect from December, 1956.

anchor.surface_text: One of the companyditions Was that the respondents were entitled to realise rent from the tenants who were directed to attorn to respondents 1-3 with effect from December, 1956.

facts.text: Pursuant to this direction the respondents collected the rent from the appellant from and after December 4, 1956.

anchor.surface_text: Pursuant to this direction the respondents companylected the rent from the appellant from and after December 4, 1956.

facts.text: The Delhi Rent Control Act 59 of 1958 was brought into force with effect from some time in the year 1958.

anchor.surface_text: The Delhi Rent Control Act  59 of 1958  was brought into force with effect from some time in the year 1958.

facts.text: The first respondent served on the 21st February 1964 a notice on the appellant determining the tenancy and requiring the appellant to deliver possession of the premises in his occupation.

anchor.surface_text: The first respondent served on the 21st February 1964 a numberice on the appellant determining the tenancy and requiring the appellant to deliver possession of the premises in his occupation.

facts.text: The first respondent instituted on August 7, 1964 a suit in the Civil Court at Delhi for an order in ejectment.

anchor.surface_text: He thereafter instituted on August 7, 1964 a suit in the Civil Court at Delhi for an order in ejectment.

facts.text: The suit was resisted by the appellant contending inter alia that under the provisions of Delhi Rent Control Act, 1958 the suit was not maintainable in the Civil Court and that in any event the notice served upon the appellant did not operate to terminate the tenancy.

anchor.surface_text: The suit was resisted by the appellant companytending inter alia that under the provisions of Delhi Rent Control Act, 1958 the suit was number maintainable in the Civil Court and that in any event the numberice served upon the appellant did number operate to terminate the tenancy.

facts.text: These contentions were rejected by the Trial Court and a decree in ejectment was passed.

anchor.surface_text: These companytentions were rejected by the Trial Court and a decree in ejectment was passed.

facts.text: The decree was confirmed in appeal to the District Court and in Second Appeal to the High Court.

anchor.surface_text: The decree was companyfirmed in appeal to the District Court and in Second Appeal  to the High Court.
